data.title: journalism
data.meta_description: Posts about journalism written by Decanter
data.text:
Category Archives: journalism

Undaunted cats of the streets of Kazakhstan, photographed by Evgeniya For, who affirms humans’ relationship with cats & the hope of better treatment of them. See Blogroll for a link.

Read Article →

Her camera often covering small communities, a selection of images from Amanda Lucier’s 4H Fair in Kremmling, Colorado are here. She lives in Portland, Oregon. See Blogroll for a link.

Read Article →

Photojournalist, Palani Mohan’s widely published ‘Hunting with Eagles’ series + some of his other photographic work. Born in India, raised in Australia, he now lives in Hong Kong. See Blogroll for a link.

Vanishing Giants: Elephants of Asia series / go to http://www.noorderlicht.com/en/archive/palani-mohan/ for more information / Hunting with Eagles series: Kazakh eagle hunters, western Mongolia, are disappearing / go to http://www.palanimohan.com/BOOKS/1 for […]

Read Article →

Laura El-Tantawy’s video project & book – the poignant, ‘In The Shadows of the Pyramids’: explores her memory & identity to the backdrop of Egypt’s political turmoil from 2005-2014

The book of the title was published in 2015 & has received the Deutsche Börse Photography Foundation Prize 2016. Laura El-Tantawy was born in England of Egyptian parentage. She studied in […]

Read Article →

Chris de Bode (Amsterdam) won an Alfred Fried Photography Award 2016 for his series ‘I Had a Dream’ on the aspirations of children selected from around the world. See Blogroll for a link.

Chris de Bode’s site is: http://www.chrisdebode.com/stories

Read Article →

Kiripi Katembo (1979–2015): Congolese photographer & documentary film-maker of note. See Blogroll for a link to the Artnet site under KK

“I hold in my hands a tool capable of showing what some refuse to consider as the appalling management of the urban environment,” he wrote about his acclaimed 2009 series […]

UK photojournalist, Mark Power’s sensitive images for his project: ‘Peacehaven (Homes Fit for Heroes)’ – 2014. See Blogroll for a link.

‘In 1915, while driving along England’s south coast, the entrepreneur Charles Neville had an idea. Once the war was over, his fellow countrymen – fighting in the trenches just a […]

French documentary photographer, Emmanuel Smague’s photographs from his Madagasca, Armenia & India Series. See Blogroll for a link.

Madagascar / Armenia / India

This is Sohrab Hura’s India: A selection of his photographs & a video of his photo essay ‘Pati’. He lives in New Delhi. See Blogroll for a link to his site.
